The **Bonnet** (or Hood) is the hinged cover over the engine compartment. It protects the engine and allows access for maintenance.
The **Bumper** is a shield made of plastic or metal attached to the front and rear of the car. It is designed to absorb impact in minor collisions.
The **Chassis** is the internal framework or 'skeleton' of the car. It supports the engine, wheels, and body.
The **Windshield** is the front window of the car. It protects occupants from wind and debris and contributes to the structural strength of the vehicle.

patterns: How does a car engine work?
responses: The **Engine** is the heart of your car. It converts fuel into mechanical motion to turn the wheels.
A **Piston** is a moving metal cylinder inside the engine. It moves up and down to compress fuel and transfer energy to the crankshaft.
The **Transmission** (or Gearbox) transfers power from the engine to the wheels, allowing you to change speeds efficiently.
The **Clutch** connects and disconnects the engine from the wheels. It allows you to change gears without stalling the engine.
**Brakes** slow down your car using friction. When you press the pedal, brake pads clamp onto a spinning disc (rotor) to stop the wheels.
**ABS (Anti-lock Braking System)** prevents your wheels from locking up during sudden stops, helping you steer while braking.
The **Suspension** system (springs and shock absorbers) connects the vehicle to its wheels and cushions the ride from bumps.
The **Battery** stores electricity to start the engine and power electronics (lights, radio) when the engine is off.
The **Alternator** generates electricity while the engine is running to charge the battery and power the car's electrical systems.
The **Radiator** keeps the engine cool. It passes hot coolant through thin metal fins to release heat into the air.
**White Smoke** usually indicates coolant is leaking into the engine (often a blown Head Gasket). Check your coolant levels immediately.
**Black Smoke** means the engine is burning too much fuel. This could be a clogged air filter or a fuel injector issue.
**Blue Smoke** indicates the engine is burning oil. This is serious and usually means worn piston rings or valve seals.
